properties.name: modisWorld
properties.description: Diese Spiel dient zur Erkundung des Modulkbaukastens https://www.modulbaukasten.ch/?d=Informatiker%2Fin-EFZ-Applikationsentwicklung-(ab-2021) für Informatiker/in EFZ Applikationsentwicklung. Es vermittelt kompakte Infos über sowohl pflichtige als auch wahlpflichtige Module und Überbetrieblicher Kurse für die gesamte vier Jahre der Lehre.
properties.author: ISCeco Lehrwerkstatt im Auftrag der Bundesverwaltung / EPA

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Lim98SE
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MouseHelper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Turn any object into a cursor.
description: This extension allows to replace the cursor with an object.

- The button behavior has been removed. The button object can be used instead. Some ready to use buttons can be downloaded from the [Buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons) of the asset store.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Turn any object into a mouse cursor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: cursor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedJump
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Sports and Fitness/Sports and Fitness_training_running_run.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Let platformer characters: air jump, wall jump wall sliding, coyote time and dashing.
description: * Do coyote time, also known as "ledge tolerance". It lets players jumping even after their character is no longer touching the ground for a given amount of time. It aims to give players a feeling of control and reduce frustration.
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-moves)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump shortly after leaving a platform and also jump in mid-air.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedJump

events.comment: Avoid any side effect if the feature is not used.
The timeframe is starting.
The timeframe is missed.
Coyote jump
The new value will be used next frame.
While in the coyote jump frame, the Object is treated as being on the floor. No air jump can happen.
When the object fall, it doesn't jump but air jumps must be allowed

The order of these events is important because the idle state is:
on the floor and jump key released but the 1st jump must not count.
Reset air jump counter.
Allow air jumps.
Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the coyote time duration of an object (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SetCoyoteTime

events.comment: Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump and slide against walls.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: WallJump

events.comment: Avoid a jump from the floor to do a wall jump because of the allowed timeframe.
Reset default character configuration when a jump that is not a wall jump happens (for instance an air jump).
To know when jumping from the floor or not.
Reset default character configuration when the character change of direction or start to fall.
When the character tries to move but can't actually move, it's against a wall.
Save the previous position for the wall detection.

To be permissive, when the jump key was pressed right before the character touch the wall,
it is still detected as a wall jump which reset the air jump counter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedProjectile
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Control how a projectile moves including speed, acceleration, distance, and lifetime.
description: Control how a projectile moves including speed, acceleration, distance, and lifetime.
- To simulate a rocket, use a starting speed of 0 and a positive acceleration (max speed may also be used)
- To simulate a hand grenade, use a high starting speed, a negative acceleration, and a non-zero lifetime
- If the object is not moving, acceleration will be towards the direction it is facing
- If the object is moving, acceleration will be in the direction the object is moving

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Control how a projectile object moves including lifetime, distance, speed, and acceleration.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedProjectile

events.comment: Record starting position so Max distance can be calculated
Apply starting speed
Save the speed and angle the object is moving (and then stop the object)
If stopped, move in direction the object is facing
If moving, move in direction the object is facing
Start Lifetime timer
Save the speed the object is moving
If stopped, move in direction the object is facing
If moving, move in direction the object is facin
Stop the object if it is moving away from object angle.  Required for min speed to work.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: - smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
Instances will start their movement from their initial position on the scene.
The center position will be decided according to the "initial direction" angle and the radius.
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.

Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMultitouchJoystick
description: Multitouch joysticks can be used the same way as physical gamepads:
- Controls mapping for top-down movement and platformer characters
There are ready-to-use joysticks in the asset-store [multitouch joysticks pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=multitouch-joysticks-multitouch-joysticks).

events.comment: Reduce the speed to match the stick force.
Turn back at least as fast as it would stop.
Reduce the speed to match the stick force.
Turn back at least as fast as it would stop.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a button is pressed on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: IsButtonPressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Button _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is pressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a button is released on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: IsButtonReleased
eventsFunctions.sentence: Button _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is released

eventsFunctions.description: Change a button state for a multitouch controller.
eventsFunctions.name: SetButtonState
eventsFunctions.sentence: Mark _PARAM2_ button as _PARAM3_ for multitouch controller _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the dead zone radius of a joystick. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved).
eventsFunctions.name: SetDeadZone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the dead zone of multitouch joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the dead zone radius of a joystick. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved).
eventsFunctions.name: DeadZone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change multitouch joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ dead zone to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: the direction index (left = 1, bottom = 1, right = 2, top = 3) for an angle (in degrees).
eventsFunctions.name: AngleTo4Way

eventsFunctions.name: IsAngleIn8WayDirection

eventsFunctions.name: IsDirectionPushed8Way
eventsFunctions.sentence: Joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

events.comment: Make sure the joystick has moved from center

eventsFunctions.description: the percentage the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: JoystickForce

eventsFunctions.description: the force of multitouch contoller stick (from 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: StickForce

eventsFunctions.description: Change the percentage the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).

eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the force of the joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the angle the joystick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).
eventsFunctions.name: JoystickAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Return the angle the multitouch controller stick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).
eventsFunctions.name: StickAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Change the angle the joystick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).
eventsFunctions.name: SetJoystickAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the angle of the joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the multitouch contoller stick force on X axis (from -1 at the left to 1 at the right).

eventsFunctions.description: Return the multitouch contoller stick force on Y axis (from -1 at the top to 1 at the bottom).

eventsFunctions.sentence: A new touch has started on the _PARAM2_ side of the screen on _PARAM1_'s layer

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Joystick that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MultitouchJoystick

events.comment: Move thumb back to center when not being pressed (acts like a spring on a real controller)

parameters: AngleBetweenPositions(Object.CenterX(), Object.CenterY(), TouchX(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0), TouchY(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0))
AngleBetweenPositions(Object.CenterX(), Object.CenterY(), TouchX(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0), TouchY(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0))
clamp(2 * DistanceBetweenPositions(Object.CenterX(), Object.CenterY(), TouchX(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0), TouchY(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0)) / Object.Width(), 0, 1)

eventsFunctions.description: the joystick force (from 0 to 1).
